definition: to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
(negative prefix)/not/no

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: According to the story, Lao-tzu, the older of the two sages, thought very little of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 据说，两位圣人中那位年长的老于很瞧不起孔子。

sentences.english: A great dog scorns the snarling of a little dog .
sentences.chinese: 一只大狗瞧不起一只小狗的咆哮。

sentences.english: Speaking disparagingly of people in front of their friends.
sentences.chinese: 在旁人的朋友面前说一些瞧不起他的话。

sentences.english: Gone are the days when the farmers were looked down upon.
sentences.chinese: 农民被人瞧不起的日子一去不复返了。

sentences.english: My friend turns up his nose at anyone who hasn't had a college education.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友对没有受过大学教育的人一律瞧不起。

sentences.english: Cover girls despise me no money, no power.
sentences.chinese: 盖少女们瞧不起我无钱无势。

sentences.english: The preference for lighter skin and prejudice against dark-skinned people is deep-rooted in Chinese tradition.
sentences.chinese: 中国根深蒂固的传统观念推崇白人但瞧不起黑人。

sentences.english: Don't look down on the role women can play.
sentences.chinese: 不要瞧不起妇女的作用。

sentences.english: It seemed to be her fate to become involved with men whose presence cheapened her.
sentences.chinese: 似乎她命中注定要与那些瞧不起她的男人搅和在一起。

sentences.english: You were looked down upon, and was disrespected.
sentences.chinese: 你被人瞧不起，得不到尊重。

sentences.english: So I don't demean that any more than I demean soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 所以我不贬低它，我更瞧不起肥皂剧。

sentences.english: If you are a coward, you will eventually be looked down upon.
sentences.chinese: 你若是个懦夫，终究会被人瞧不起。

sentences.english: They look down upon those who live in intellectual backwater.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞧不起智力处于停滞状态的人。

sentences.english: Snobs are usually contemptuous of people they feel to be beneath them.
sentences.chinese: 势利者通常瞧不起他们认为地位在他们之下的人。

sentences.english: I still go on underrating men of gold .
sentences.chinese: 我仍瞧不起腰缠万金的人。

sentences.english: To love a women who scorns you is like licking honey from thorn .
sentences.chinese: 爱一个瞧不起你的女人无异于荆中舔蜜。

definition: to look down upon/to despise
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to show respect for/to think highly of
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
to sneer at sb/to ridicule
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to despise/to look down upon/despicable
to jeer at/to deride/to ridicule/mockery/derision
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
contempt/contemptuous/to despise/to scorn/scornful
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to loathe/to despise/contempt
to be self-interested
a cut above others/superior
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
